1.text: The plans of the heart belong to man, but the reply of the tongue is from the LORD.

2.text: All a man’s ways are pure in his own eyes, but his motives are weighed out by the LORD.

3.text: Commit your works to the LORD and your plans will be achieved.

4.text: The LORD has made everything for His purpose—even the wicked for the day of disaster.

5.text: Everyone who is proud in heart is detestable to the LORD; be assured that he will not go unpunished.

6.text: By loving devotion and faithfulness iniquity is atoned for, and by the fear of the LORD one turns aside from evil.

7.text: When a man’s ways please the LORD, He makes even the man’s enemies live at peace with him.

8.text: Better a little with righteousness than great gain with injustice.

9.text: A man’s heart plans his course, but the LORD determines his steps.

10.text: A divine verdict is on the lips of a king; his mouth must not betray justice.

11.text: Honest scales and balances are from the LORD; all the weights in the bag are His concern.

12.text: Wicked behavior is detestable for kings, for a throne is established through righteousness.

13.text: Righteous lips are a king’s delight, and he who speaks honestly is beloved.

14.text: The wrath of a king is a messenger of death, but a wise man will pacify it.

15.text: When a king’s face brightens, there is life; his favor is like a rain cloud in spring.

16.text: How much better to acquire wisdom than gold! To gain understanding is more desirable than silver.

17.text: The highway of the upright leads away from evil; he who guards his way protects his life.

18.text: Pride goes before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a fall.

19.text: It is better to be lowly in spirit among the humble than to divide the spoil with the proud.

20.text: Whoever heeds instruction will find success, and blessed is he who trusts in the LORD.

21.text: The wise in heart are called discerning, and pleasant speech promotes instruction.

22.text: Understanding is a fountain of life to its possessor, but the discipline of fools is folly.

23.text: The heart of the wise man instructs his mouth and adds persuasiveness to his lips.

24.text: Pleasant words are a honeycomb, sweet to the soul and healing to the bones.

25.text: There is a way that seems right to a man, but its end is the way of death.

26.text: A worker’s appetite works for him because his hunger drives him onward.

27.text: A worthless man digs up evil, and his speech is like a scorching fire.

28.text: A perverse man spreads dissension, and a gossip divides close friends.

29.text: A violent man entices his neighbor and leads him down a path that is not good.

30.text: He who winks his eye devises perversity; he who purses his lips is bent on evil.

31.text: Gray hair is a crown of glory; it is attained along the path of righteousness.

32.text: He who is slow to anger is better than a warrior, and he who controls his temper is greater than one who captures a city.

33.text: The lot is cast into the lap, but its every decision is from the LORD.
